section.title: can and can't
section.sectiontitle: We use I/you/he/she/it/we/they + can + verb to say it's possible to do something.
section.text1a: You can eat Chinese food in the city centre.
section.sectiontitle2: We use I/you/he/she/it/we/they + cannot + verb to say it's not possible to do something. We usually use the short form.
section.text4: I cannot come to the cinema this evening.
section.text4a: I can't come to the cinema this evening.

section.title: can: question form
section.sectiontitle: In the question, we use can + I/you/he/she/it/we/they + verb.
section.text1a: Can you play tennis today? Yes, I can.
section.text2: People can't park their cars here.
section.text2a: Can people park their cars here? No, they can't.
